content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a differentiable function with a domain of <math alttext="open parenthesis, 0 comma 10, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. It is known that <math alttext="f prime of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>â€²</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>, the derivative of <math alttext="f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, is negative on the intervals <math alttext="open parenthesis, 0 comma 2, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="open parenthesis, 4 comma 6, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and positive on the intervals <math alttext="open parenthesis, 2 comma 4, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="open parenthesis, 6 comma 10, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has no relative minima and three relative maxima.
<math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has one relative minimum and two relative maxima.
<math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has two relative minima and one relative maximum.
<math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has three relative minima and no relative maxima.

content.answer: <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has two relative minima and one relative maximum.

topic.text: 5.4: Using the First Derivative Test to Determine Relative (Local) Extrema

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
